reviews.review_msg: I'm not sure why Leanne has so many positive reviews on here, as I've taken two classes with her and haven't been impressed for either one. Her lectures have little to no content in them, the tutorials are completely disconnected from the lecture content, and the readings are useless. Grading is all over the place. Do not recommend for 324 or 363

John really knows his stuff. I would use the word "passionate" to describe his views on the environment. It's easy to see his bias, but unless you disagree with it, a lot of what he says makes sense. He's a bit geeky but it's endearing to his character. Make sure you keep up with the text and especially tutorials. The final was the hardest part.

John is a great prof. He is genuine and really wants you to do well. He does not provide lecture notes to encourage note taking and attendance. His exams and assignments are very fair. His voice is monotone so if you can't handle it don't take his class.

Very Good Prof. Make sure to have a laptop handy and ask lots of questions. He is very willing to explain in detail what he expects, and as long as you follow his guidelines you cant fail.The Tutorial was kinda dry with lots of presentation, which is better than group discussions since the class size was about 45 in only one tutorial at SFU HC

John's a funny, laid back guy. He wears his politics on his sleeve, but backs it up with evidence and experience. Yeah, his voice is somewhat monotonous--but why should a prof have to act like Andy **** just to get your attention? The tutorial involved multiple presentations on the same article, which wasn't great, but the class was good overall.
